text: Tetragonia cristata is a member of the genus Tetragonia endemic to Australia. The annual herb has a prostrate habit and typically grows to a height of and has stems up of in length. It blooms between July and September producing yellow flowers. Often found on clay flats and amongst granite outcrops it has a scattered distribution throughout the Mid West region of Western Australia where it grows in sandy or clay soils. ==References== cristata Category:Flora of Western Australia Category:Plants described in 1983
title: Tetragonia cristata
